Description: Fragment of foot and wall of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl or plate. Interior glazed with impressed decoration: four palmettes at centre, ring of ovules around; to outside, eight linked palmettes and a groove; outside black; slight ring foot glazed; underside of foot reserved with one broad band and a thin on to the inside. Graffito under foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Pavilion & Museums, Brighton & Hove. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2170)
